definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: My grandfather was dying also and only survived her a few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 外公也时日无多，只比外婆多活了几个星期。

sentences.english: Both of us knew he had little time left.
sentences.chinese: 我俩都知道他已时日无多了。

sentences.english: And for a while it seemed as if the days of chimney sweeps were numbered.
sentences.chinese: 暂时看来似乎烟囱清扫人的需求也时日无多。

sentences.english: Knowing that he did not have much time left, my grandfather asked my mother to prepare the mourning clothes.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷自知时日无多，吩咐妈妈准备葬礼用的五服。

sentences.english: If he doesn't get this large contract, John's days may be numbered at the company.
sentences.chinese: 约翰若没做成这笔大生意，那他在公司就时日无多了。

sentences.english: Still, the ethanol industry's days may be numbered.
sentences.chinese: 但是乙醇工业仍然时日无多。

definition: on one's deathbed/at the point of death
lit. the disease has attacked the vitals (idiom); fig. beyond cure/the situation is hopeless
to approach one's coffin (idiom); with one foot in the grave
approaching one's end/with one foot in the grave
to be critically ill/to be terminally ill
one's late days/to have one foot in the grave
to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
lit. to fly on a crane to the Western Paradise/fig. to pass away (idiom)
